        <td class="docs">
          <div class="pilwrap">
  <a class="pilcrow" href="#section-11" id="section-11"></a>
</div>
<p>Insert a hidden input as a replacement for the missing submit button
The hidden input is inserted in two cases:</p>
<ul>
<li>A user defined a <code>submitHandler</code></li>
<li>There was a pending request due to <code>remote</code> method and <code>stopRequest()</code>
was called to submit the form in case it's valid</li>
</ul>

        </td>
        <td class="code highlight">

							.attr( <span class="hljs-string">"name"</span>, validator.submitButton.name )
							.val( $( validator.submitButton ).val() )
							.appendTo( validator.currentForm );
					}

						result = validator.settings.submitHandler.call( validator, validator.currentForm, event );
						<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> ( hidden ) {

</pre>

	<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> ( <span class="hljs-built_in">arguments</span>.length === <span class="hljs-number">1</span> ) {

		params = [ params ];
	}
	$.each( params, <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span>(<span class="hljs-params"> i, n </span>) </span>{
		source = source.replace( <span class="hljs-keyword">new</span> <span class="hljs-built_in">RegExp</span>( <span class="hljs-string">"\\{"</span> + i + <span class="hljs-string">"\\}"</span>, <span class="hljs-string">"g"</span> ), <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span>(<span class="hljs-params"></span>) </span>{
			<span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> n;
		} );
	} );
	<span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> source;
};

$.extend( $.validator, {

	<span class="hljs-attr">defaults</span>: {
		<span class="hljs-attr">messages</span>: {},
		<span class="hljs-attr">groups</span>: {},
		<span class="hljs-attr">rules</span>: {},

      <tr>
        <td class="docs">
          <div class="pilwrap">
  <a class="pilcrow" href="#section-59" id="section-59"></a>
</div>
<p>The second parameter 'rule' used to be a string, and extended to an object literal
of the following form:
rule = {
method: &quot;method name&quot;,
parameters: &quot;the given method parameters&quot;
}</p>
<p>The old behavior still supported, kept to maintain backward compatibility with
old code, and will be removed in the next major release.</p>

			<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> ( <span class="hljs-keyword">this</span>.optional( element ) ) {

				validator, data, optionDataString;

			<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> ( previous.old === optionDataString ) {
				<span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> previous.valid;
			}

			validator = <span class="hljs-keyword">this</span>;

						validator.formSubmitted = submitted;
						validator.successList.push( element );

						validator.showErrors();

        <td class="docs">
          <div class="pilwrap">
  <a class="pilcrow" href="#section-118" id="section-118"></a>
</div>
<p>Ajax mode: abort
usage: $.ajax({ mode: &quot;abort&quot;[, port: &quot;uniqueport&quot;]});
if mode:&quot;abort&quot; is used, the previous request on that port (port can be undefined) is aborted via XMLHttpRequest.abort()</p>

        </td>
        <td class="code highlight">
          <pre class="javascript">
<span class="hljs-keyword">var</span> pendingRequests = {},
	ajax;

</pre>
        </td>
      </tr>

		<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> ( settings.mode === <span class="hljs-string">"abort"</span> ) {
			<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> ( pendingRequests[ port ] ) {
				pendingRequests[ port ].abort();
			}
			pendingRequests[ port ] = xhr;
		}
	} );
} <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span> {

</pre>
